column1: Nasal flaring is seen mostly in infants and younger children.
Any condition that causes difficulty breathing can cause nasal flaring.
In young infants, nasal flaring can be a very important symptom of respiratory distress.
Seek immediate emergency help if you or your child has signs of a breathing difficulty.
Call your health care provider if: - There is any persistent, unexplained nasal flaring, especially in a young child.
- You think that your child is having trouble breathing.
